TITLE: Consumers see inflation—and spending—cooling off in the year ahead, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: The one-year inflation outlook declined to 5%, down 0.2 percentage point from the previous month and the lowest level since July 2021.

TITLE: France's government outlines plans to raise retirement age despite years of pushback
SUMMARY: France's legal retirement age is currently 62 — lower than many developed markets, including much of Europe and the U.S.

TITLE: World Bank makes big cut to its 2023 growth outlook, says globe is 'perilously close' to recession
SUMMARY: The World Bank slashed its global growth forecasts from projections it made in mid-2022 on the back of what it sees as broadly worsening economic conditions.

TITLE: Time for the Fed to declare victory on inflation? Not yet
SUMMARY: The question now is how much more evidence policymakers will need to see before they take their foot off the brake.

TITLE: Consumer prices fell 0.1% in December, in line with expectations from economists
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to decrease 0.1% on a monthly basis and increase 6.5% from a year ago in December, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: As China reopens and data surprises, economists are starting to get less gloomy
SUMMARY: After China's reopening and a deluge of positive data surprises, economists are upgrading their previously gloomy outlooks for the global economy.

TITLE: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell tests positive for Covid
SUMMARY: Powell is experiencing "mild symptoms," according to the announcement.

TITLE: Wholesale prices fell 0.5% in December, much more than expected; retail sales fall
SUMMARY: The producer price index was expected to decrease 0.1% in December, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Here's what you need to know about a blockbuster court fight over Cuba's debt
SUMMARY: If Cuba loses in the U.K.'s High Court, it could ultimately cost the island nation billions in long overdue payments.

TITLE: U.S. GDP rose 2.9% in the fourth quarter, more than expected even as recession fears loom
SUMMARY: Gross domestic product was expected to rise 2.8% at an annualized pace in the fourth quarter, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Key Fed inflation measure eased in December while consumer spending also declined
SUMMARY: The personal consumption price index excluding food and energy for December increased 4.4% from a year ago.

TITLE: Important wage inflation measure for the Fed rose less than expected in Q4
SUMMARY: The employment cost index increased 1% in the October-to-December period, the Labor Department reported Tuesday.

TITLE: Euro zone economy posts surprise expansion in the fourth quarter, curbing recession fears
SUMMARY: Euro zone narrowly avoided a contraction as energy prices provide some relief.

TITLE: IMF hikes global growth forecast as inflation cools and household spending surprises
SUMMARY: In its latest economic update, the institution said the global economy will grow 2.9% this year.

TITLE: Private payroll growth slowed to 106,000 in January as weather hit hiring, ADP says
SUMMARY: Companies added just 106,000 new workers for the month, down from an upwardly revised 253,000 the month before.

TITLE: Black women are gaining ground in the labor market but still face unique barriers
SUMMARY: January's jobs data shows the unemployment rate fell for Black women. A tight labor market may be playing a role.

TITLE: Here’s where the jobs are for January 2023 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Leisure and hospitality saw an increase of 128,000 jobs in the month, led by 99,000 jobs in restaurants and bars alone.

TITLE: Jobs report shows increase of 517,000 in January, crushing estimates, as unemployment rate hit 53-year low
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 187,000 in January, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs will be during the rolling recessions
SUMMARY: Recession-like conditions rolling through the U.S. economy are likely to cause more ripples through an otherwise strong jobs market.

TITLE: Inflation report due Tuesday has the potential to deliver some bad news
SUMMARY: All market eyes Tuesday will be on the release of the Labor Department's consumer price index.

TITLE: Inflation rose 0.5% in January, more than expected and up 6.4% from a year ago
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.4% in January from a month ago and 6.2% on an annual basis, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: U.S. inflation is likely 'far stickier' and could last a decade, Bill Smead says
SUMMARY: Inflation in the U.S. is likely to be "far stickier" and could last a decade, according to Bill Smead, chief investment officer at Smead Capital Management.

TITLE: Retail sales jump 3% in January, smashing expectations despite inflation increase
SUMMARY: Retail sales were expected to increase 1.9% in January, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: Russia's budget deficit has surged. But economists say Moscow won't drain its war chest any time soon
SUMMARY: Russia's budget deficit hit a record 1.8 trillion rubles ($24.4 million) in January, with spending growing by 58% from the previous year while revenues fell by more than a third.

TITLE: Consumer debt hits record $16.9 trillion as delinquencies also rise
SUMMARY: Debt across all categories totaled $16.9 trillion as balances rose across all major categories.

TITLE: Wholesale prices rose 0.7% in January, more than expected, fueling inflation increase
SUMMARY: The producer price index, a measure of what raw goods fetch on the open market, rose 0.7% in January.

TITLE: Sanctions on Russian oil are having the 'intended effect,' IEA says
SUMMARY: Bans and price caps targeting Russian oil are having the "intended effect" despite surprisingly resilient exports in recent months, according to the International Energy Agency.

TITLE: UK economy in 'a lot better shape' than bleak figures suggest, fund manager says
SUMMARY: The U.K. has thus far avoided a widely anticipated recession, and the economy may be holding up better than feared, according to veteran fund manager Andy Brough.

TITLE: Fed can't tame inflation without 'significantly' more hikes that will cause a recession, paper says
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is unlikely to be able to bring down inflation without having to push rates considerably higher, according to a research paper.

TITLE: Key Fed inflation measure rose 0.6% in January, more than expected
SUMMARY: The core PCE price index was expected to increase 0.5% from a month ago and 4.4% on an annual basis, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: OECD says global economic outlook 'slightly better' for 2023 but inflation risks linger
SUMMARY: OECD Secretary-General Mathias Cormann said the global economic outlook is looking slightly "brighter" for this year but inflation challenges remain.

TITLE: The racial retirement savings gap remains wide – How these state IRA programs are working toward equity
SUMMARY: Workers have put away $735 million in state retirement savings programs that are intended to help employees at small businesses.

TITLE: Euro zone inflation softens to 8.5% in February as ECB signals interest rate hiking is not over
SUMMARY: Inflation in the euro zone came in at 8.5% in February, while the ECB signalled interest rate hikes could still continue.

TITLE: Tesla is not the only company reviewing its Europe investment after Biden's Inflation Reduction Act
SUMMARY: Many multinationals are reconsidering or changing previous plans to deploy new money into Europe.

TITLE: How China's shifting growth picture could hit global markets
SUMMARY: China's economy will be forced to recalibrate because of a "fractured" global order, and the new drivers of growth will "disappoint" global markets, according to David Roche.

TITLE: Fed's Powell heads to Capitol Hill this week, and he's going to have his hands full
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell to appear before Congress with a tall task.

TITLE: Private payrolls rose by 242,000 in February, better than expected, ADP says
SUMMARY: Companies added jobs at a brisk pace in February as the labor market kept humming, payroll services firm ADP reported Wednesday.

TITLE: Job openings declined in January but still far outnumber available workers
SUMMARY: The Labor Department's Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey showed there are 10.824 million openings, down some 410,000 from December.

TITLE: Payrolls rose 311,000 in February, more than expected, showing solid growth
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 225,000 in February, while the unemployment rate was projected to hold at 3.4%, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: UK economy rebounds with stronger-than-expected January GDP print
SUMMARY: The U.K. economy grew by 0.3% in January, official figures showed on Friday, exceeding expectations as it continues to fend off what economists see as an inevitable recession.

TITLE: Just like that: Market pricing swings back to quarter-point Fed rate hike
SUMMARY: One bank implosion and a cooperative jobs report later, and the market has changed its mind.

TITLE: Unemployment for Black and Hispanic women rose in February, but more workers join the labor force
SUMMARY: Black women saw their unemployment rate jump to 5.1% from 4.7%. Among Hispanic women, it jumped to 4.8% from 4.4%.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for February 2023 — in one chart
SUMMARY: The leisure and hospitality sector added 105,000 jobs last month, according to the Labor Department, accounting for roughly a third of the total jobs gain.

TITLE: Inflation gauge increased 0.4% in February, as expected and up 6% from a year ago
SUMMARY: Excluding volatile food and energy prices, core CPI increased 0.5% in February and 5.5% on a 12-month basis.

TITLE: Something broke, but the Fed is still expected to go through with rate hikes
SUMMARY: Markets still expect the Fed to keep up its inflation-fighting efforts, despite high-profile bank failures that have rattled the financial system.

TITLE: Wholesale prices post unexpected decline of 0.1% in February; retail sales fall
SUMMARY: The producer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in February, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Moody's Analytics' Mark Zandi says Fed unlikely to hike rates in March given banking turmoil
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve will likely not raise interest rates at its March meeting as there is still a "boatload of uncertainty" said Mark Zandi of Moody's Analytics.

TITLE: European Central Bank hikes rates despite market mayhem, pledges support if needed
SUMMARY: Some market players questioned whether President Christine Lagarde would proceed with a hike, given recent shocks in the banking sector.

TITLE: Long-awaited Fed digital payment system to launch in July
SUMMARY: FedNow creates "a leading-edge payments system that is resilient, adaptive, and accessible," said Richmond Fed President Tom Barkin.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs cuts GDP forecast because of stress on small banks, which are key to U.S. economy
SUMMARY: Goldman on Wednesday lowered its 2023 economic growth forecast, citing a pullback in lending from small- and medium-sized banks.

TITLE: One of the best ways to figure out what the Fed will do next is to look at regional bank stocks
SUMMARY: Markets have changed their mind — again — about what they think the Federal Reserve will do next week regarding interest rates.

TITLE: Fed poised to approve quarter-point rate hike next week, despite market turmoil
SUMMARY: Chairman Jerome Powell and his fellow central bankers will want to signal that it's important to continue the fight to bring down inflation.

TITLE: One year after the first rate hike, the Fed stands at policy crossroads
SUMMARY: The Fed in some ways is both closer and further away from its goals when it first started raising rates.

TITLE: Fed poised to approve quarter-point rate hike this week, despite market turmoil
SUMMARY: Chairman Jerome Powell and his fellow central bankers will want to signal that it's important to continue the fight to bring down inflation.

TITLE: BlackRock warns that investors are making a mistake by betting on the Fed to cut rates
SUMMARY: The expectation for cuts would be consistent with a recession and an accompanying fall in inflation.

TITLE: Jobless claims edge up to 198,000, higher than expected
SUMMARY: Jobless claims rose 7,000 from the previous period and were a bit higher than the 195,000 estimate.

TITLE: Paying more and earning less: How inflation disproportionately hurts women
SUMMARY: Inflation has been found to disproportionately affect women — and data is showing that some of the economic progress for American women is already unraveling.

TITLE: It's the U.S., not Europe's banking system that's a concern, top economists say
SUMMARY: Europe learned its lessons after the financial crisis and is now in a strong position to weather further stress in its banking system, several economists and policymakers say.

TITLE: Key Fed inflation gauge rose 0.3% in February, less than expected
SUMMARY: The personal consumption expenditures price index excluding food and energy was expected to rise 0.4% in February.

TITLE: Job openings tumbled below 10 million in February for the first time in nearly two years
SUMMARY: Available positions totaled 9.93 million, a drop of 632,000 from January's downwardly revised number.

TITLE: Private payrolls rose by 145,000 in March, well below expectations, ADP says
SUMMARY: Company payrolls rose by 145,000, down from 261,000 in February and below the Dow Jones estimate for 210,000.

TITLE: Layoffs are up nearly fivefold so far this year with tech companies leading the way
SUMMARY: Companies announced nearly 90,000 layoffs in March, a sharp step up from the previous month.

TITLE: IMF says U.S-China tensions could cost the world about 2% of its output
SUMMARY: Companies and policymakers are exploring ways to make their supply chains more resilient by "moving production home or to trusted countries," the IMF said.

TITLE: Job growth totals 236,000 in March, near expectations as hiring pace slows
SUMMARY: The Labor Department reported Friday that payrolls grew by 236,000 for the month, compared to the Dow Jones estimate for 238,000.
